lexUnit.name: stream.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of liquid) run in a continuous flow.

sentence.text: I looked round and there was blood streaming from this guy 's head .
There was blood streaming down her white nightdress and also soaking the bedcovers .
Blood from my arm came streaming back into my face , in spite of the fact that I was holding the stump as tightly as I could .
Blood streamed down his face and back .
As the first rays of morning sunlight streamed through the open doorway , the newly-plastered room looked as though it had been covered in the night by a fine layer of pinkish-buff snow .
Sunlight streamed down over tawny bracken and the plum-bloom of the heather .
Mabel pulled back the curtains , and sunlight streamed in .
Sunlight streamed in from the windows above the gallery , bathing the polished panels of the walls in a warm glow .
A beam of sunlight streaming through the crack in the door hit her closed eyes .
Wull shouted , tears streaming down his cheeks .
So they sat on a blanket and clung to each other , tears streaming down their cheeks .
I just ca n't s-seem to help it , " she wept , unable to staunch the heavy flow of tears streaming down her pale cheeks .
He looked up at them , panic-stricken , water streaming down his face .
He tells the despairing Moses to strike a rock with his rod , and water will stream forth from it for the people to drink .
The door opened , and Willis stood there , like a drowned man risen from the dead , his spectacles gone , water streaming from him and instantly making a pool at his feet .
He carried her close , oblivious , it seemed , of the water that streamed from her body , and carried her to the safe , dry grass a short distance away .
The wind , having done its worst , eased and died down , but the cold rain streamed from clouds which obscured the moonlight that was needed so much .
Looking out of the window , Branson saw flames streaming momentarily from an engine ; then the plane righted itself and flew on .
They levelled out at four hundred feet above the hills , belting north , three hundred and fifty on the clock , black smoke streaming from the exhaust stubs .
Pulses of laser light streamed from the right-hand passage and blasted white-hot holes in the opposite wall .
The modern car ferry was like a nautical greenhouse with the sun streaming in the south-facing picture windows -- passengers ' heads wilting with heat and motion like so many tomato plants .
At the same moment , a rush of flame came from the rear , followed by a flock of fire-arrows streaming into the rigging .
She drew back the curtains and the sun streamed into the room .
Daylight streamed through the aircraft windows .
Morning light streamed through the window searching out the shabbiness and the dust , the peeling walls and cobwebbed corners .
A kite on a line generates lift from the wind streaming past it ; but if released it soon reaches the same speed as the surrounding air and loses it all .
Sweat was dripping from my nose and chin and streaming from under my arms .
The tea streamed , honey-gold , from a blue pot , and round the door came the cat Hastings , pert of face , in search of cream .
And there was something wrong with the weather ; the rain streamed , but not steadily , and the sky seemed full of noise and disturbances , like great clouds battling .
Just when you thought you 'd got some idea of the size , a cloud would stream past and the perspective would wind back .
